commitResults.messageBody:
Renamed bot,
Added greet and exit functionality
chatbot will greet and exit
bot only greets and exits
slave will echo user's input
slave can now add items to list, and list out the items in the list
slave can now mark tasks as done and not done
bug fix for issue with mark and unmark function not parsing string correctly
created Todo, Deadline, Event classes
modified runtest.bat such that it can be run successfully
delete feature implemented

refactored code as per coding standards:

* moved all files into a package
* listed all import files instead of importing all
* removed indentation for switch case

refactored code as per coding standards:

* moved all files into a package
* listed all import files instead of importing all
* removed indentation for switch case

save and load method implemented
save() method is called at the end of every of the following method calls:

*addToList()
*deleteTask()
*markAsDone()
*markAsIncomplete()

load method is called at the start of the program
in the event of a missing save file, program will skip over the load() method

bug fix for where loading of tasks from save file in previous commit
did not pull the full string after /from and /to for events, due to the assumption
that there is only one string without spacing after each identifier
commiting in a new branch instead of on main
commit does not affect execution of program

commented out level-7 changes
trying to create new branch, commit on that branch, then merge into main
added changes required for level 7
pushing level-7 changes

commitResults.messageTitle: bug fix for toString in Event class
commitResults.messageBody: it was previously missing a space which resulted in errors when calling the load() method
implemented the changes necessary for reading dates after /from, /by, and /to

Deadline and Events now store a LocalDate instead of a String

keyword "schedule (date in yyyy-mm-dd format)" displays all deadlines due after the date,
and events happening on the date

"schedule (date)" is able to handle bad inputs, eg. "schedule ", "schedule", "schedule (date)",
where the date does not follow the format yyyy-mm-dd.
All bad inputs will be rejected and no Tasks will be printed

Slave methods broken down into 3 classes:

*Ui
*Storage
*Parser

functionality unchanged

fix issue where new file and directory is not created if the path does not exist

fix issue where "bye" does not terminate the program

the individual class methods by changing return type of some methods
from void to boolean

asserts added to help ensure the correctness of the execution of the code
at runtime to check that the code is working as intended

asserts used in the following files
* Parser.java
* MainWindow.java
add asserts to code

refactoring done for:
* Parser.java
* Storage.java

shortened lengthy code in the files via abstraction
branch-A-CodeQuality

A new abstract class "RecurringTypeTask" was created to add the recurringType parameter to all tasks
that can have recurrences. Deadline and Event classes now extend from RecurringTypeTask

An enum is used to define the recurring type of tasks, with the following possible options:
* Daily
* Weekly
* Monthly
* Bimonthly
* Quarterly
* Biannually
* Annually

The format which tasks are saved in in the save file is also changed to accomodate the addition of the
recurrence type.

Upon launching the application Slave will:
* Highlight the tasks that have ended prior to the day of launching the application.
This list of tasks will not be stored after closing the application.
* Create new recurring tasks for tasks that have ended prior to the day of launching the application
and add them to the task list.
* Remove all tasks that have ended prior to the day of launching the application.

Slave will allow the creation of tasks that have already ended prior to the day of creation, to allow
users to not have to calculate date of its next occurance for recurring tasks.
For non recurring tasks, it does not affect the functionality of the application as it will be removed
from the task list the next time the application is run
Bcd extension

commitResults.messageTitle: Creating Slave object throws Concurrent Modification Exception
commitResults.messageBody:
Adding and removing Tasks from the task list using a forEach()
method causes Concurrent Modification Exception to be thrown when
trying to identify deadlines or events that have ended

Let's separate the removing of tasks and addition of tasks from
the checking of tasks that have ended to prevent the exception from
being thrown

commitResults.messageTitle: No differentiation between good and bad user input
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently good and bad user inputs have the same appearance.
It is not immediately clear to the user when they have provided a bad
input.

Let's change the appearance of the dialog box when the user provides a
bad input, by changing its color to red.

Previous refactoring of the markAsDone() and markAsIncomplete() methods
have created bugs in the  testcases.

The affected testcases have been modified to accept the new return type
of a String array.

commitResults.messageTitle: Clean up code style using checkstyle
commitResults.messageBody:
Checkstyle was used to check the code for coding standard violations.

The blocks of code causing the violations have been changed, and the
code now passes the checkstyle audit.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add chatbot name to window title
commitResults.messageBody:
The title bar of the window now displays "Slave" to meet submission
requirements.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix issue with Todo display format
commitResults.messageBody:
There was an issue with the display format of a Todo Task
where there was no space between the task name and the square
brackets indicating if the task was complete.

A space is added to make it easier for the user to read the task
name.

Previous readme update updated the readme in the root directory.

Current readme update updated the readme in /docs directory
